body.p: The reason given for the Board’s action is that implementation problems with SFAS 144 have emerged in the US. (Most of these problems seem to be with the guidance concerning the definition in SFAS 144, rather than the definition itself.) In paragraph BC71, the Board describes its action as an interim measure, and plans to work with the FASB to arrive promptly at a converged solution. In Mr Cope’s view, it would have been much preferable to have converged first, and then dealt with any implementation problems jointly with the FASB.
